newsitem.title: SWEDEN: S&P affirms Saga Petroleum BBB+ rating.
newsitem.headline: S&P affirms Saga Petroleum BBB+ rating.

text.p: U.S. credit rating agency Standard & Poor's (S&P) on Wednesday affirmed the senior unsecured debt rating for Saga Petroleum A.S. at BBB+ after the company's acquisition of Kuwaiti-owned North Sea exploration group Santa Fe Exploration Ltd.
It said Saga's outlook was stable.
S&P said Saga was to pay $1.2 billion to state-owned Kuwait Petroleum Corp for Santa Fe financed by debt. Initially net debt to capital will rise to around 60 percent against 31 percent this August.
"While a dramatic increase, the rating anticipated investment beyond internally generated funds," S&P said in a statement.
"Nevertheless the flexibility within the rating category is now limited and a reduction in leverage is expected in coming years although not to the pre-acquistion level."
S&P said the purchase was in line with Saga's strategy to increase its revenue base and to broaden its geographical coverage.
The agency said the company's outlook was stable.
"The flexibility within the rating category is now limited and a reduction in leverage is expected in coming years," it said.
Saga's deal is the second biggest acquisition by a Norwegian company following Kvaerner's takeover of British conglomerate Trafalgar House Plc in April for 8.9 billion crowns ($1.4 billion).
